intro: Verbascum phlomoides f. eramosum, commonly known as the woolly mullein. This plant is a flowering plant in the Scrophulariaceae family, characterized by its fuzzy, gray-green leaves and tall spikes of yellow flowers. It is a perennial herb that thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. The leaves are covered in dense, soft hairs that help reduce water loss and protect against herbivores. The flower structure is typical of the genus, with showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
